content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very simple but still hard enough for a CoC. Also an interesting problem for shortest as it can be solved in many ways and the inputs and output are simple to manage.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Approved. The problem description is clear and well-written, providing all the necessary information to understand the task at hand. The constraints are well-defined and the example helps to illustrate how the solution should work. Overall, it’s a well-crafted puzzle that challenges the problem-solving skills of the solver.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

It's easy if you know combinatorics.

Eventually you should drop the "e.g." part completely, for a human user it does not add much. But for after knowing how to solve it, for fun I copy pasted it to ChatGPT and it gave me a 100% straight forward solution without further tweaks, despite the magic forest story distraction. I think the input/output example below should do. Without the e.g. part, ChatGPT still gives a solution but it's crap, does not compile and uses dp.
I think I've made appropriate adjustments from the two previous comments. Thanks to both of you for your feedback!

Input section
* Please change "Lines 2-4" to "Line 2".

* Please add "space-separated" between "Three" and "integers".

Constraints section/Cases
* There are cases inconsistent with one of the constraints. r, b and/or g are less than 2 in those cases. Please fix either the constraint or the cases.

Thanks.
Is the description clear or should an example be included to clarify the meaning?

Overall it is pretty clear but I think giving hints or explaning the example would be better since not every one learnt combinatorics.

Also please state either one
r + g + b = n -> you can remove 2 ≤ r,b,g ≤ 12
or
State "you need to roll EXACTLY r dice(s) to be red, EXACTLY b dice(s) to be blue.." and so on.
